Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap

IMAP4rev2 server implementation for Gumdrop.

This package provides a complete IMAP server implementation following RFC 9051 (IMAP4rev2), with support for essential extensions.

Architecture

  • IMAPServer - Connection factory for IMAP connections
  • IMAPConnection - Protocol handler for IMAP sessions

Supported RFCs

IMAP RFC Support
RFCTitleStatus
RFC 9051 IMAP4rev2Core implementation
RFC 2177 IDLESupported
RFC 2342 NAMESPACESupported
RFC 6851 MOVESupported
RFC 9208 QUOTASupported
RFC 7888 LITERAL+/LITERAL-TODO
RFC 7162 CONDSTORE/QRESYNCTODO

Protocol States

  • NOT_AUTHENTICATED - Initial state, must authenticate
  • AUTHENTICATED - Logged in, can list/select mailboxes
  • SELECTED - Mailbox selected, can access messages
  • LOGOUT - Connection closing

Security Features

  • IMAPS (implicit TLS on port 993)
  • STARTTLS for connection upgrade
  • SASL authentication mechanisms via org.bluezoo.gumdrop.auth
  • LOGINDISABLED until TLS established

Configuration Example


 IMAPServer imap = new IMAPServer();
 imap.setPort(143);
 imap.setRealm(myRealm);
 imap.setMailboxFactory(new MboxMailboxFactory(new File("/var/mail")));
 
 // Optional: Enable implicit TLS
 IMAPServer imaps = new IMAPServer();
 imaps.setPort(993);
 imaps.setSecure(true);
 imaps.setSSLContext(sslContext);
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
RFC 9051 - IMAP4rev2, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.auth
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    IMAPConnection
    Connection handler for the IMAP4rev2 protocol.
    IMAPServer
    Connection factory for IMAP connections on a given port.
    IMAPServerMetrics
    OpenTelemetry metrics for IMAP servers.
    SearchParser
    Parser for IMAP SEARCH command syntax (RFC 9051 Section 6.4.4).
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    StatusItem
    Status data items that can be requested in an IMAP STATUS command.
